intro: Corydalis fabacea subsp. digitata, commonly known as the digitate corydalis, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of central and eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and clusters of delicate, pink to purple flowers that bloom in early spring. Its leaves are typically lobed or divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or meadow habitats.
